sage.model.loader

Class OBJMaterial

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.scene.Material
      • sage.model.loader.OBJMaterial

  • public class OBJMaterial
extends Material
    This class encapsulates the material information defined by one OBJ 'newmtl' command and provides accessors to obtain each of the values defined for the material. The 'newmtl' subcommands recognized by the material loader (loadMaterial(BufferedReader)) include
    • ka - ambient reflection coefficients
    • kd - diffuse reflection coefficients
    • ks - specular reflection coefficients
    • ns - shininess exponent
    • ni - index of refraction
    • tr - opacity
    • illum - OBJ-specific illumination model type
    • map_Kd - diffuse texture file name

    The current implementation does not recognize any of the following commands (it simply prints a warning message and ignores the command):

    • map_Ka # an ambient texture map
    • map_Ks # a specular texture map
    • map_d # an alpha texture map
    • map_bump # a bump map

      Returns the integer defining the illumination (shading) type associated with this model.

      Returns the String defining the diffuse texture file name which was associated with this OBJMaterial if a texture file name was defined using the OBJ map_Kd command; otherwise null is returned.

      Loads this material with data from an internally-determined source (for example, prompts for the name of a material definition file and loads from that file).

    • Constructor Detail

      • OBJMaterial

        public OBJMaterial(java.lang.String name,
                   boolean verbose)
        Constructs a new (empty) OBJMaterial object. The data values defining the material should be loaded into the empty OBJMaterial by calling loadMaterial(BufferedReader), passing a BufferedReader containing the material description parameters in the form defined by the OBJ "mtllib" file format. Alternatively, this class may be extended and the subclass can override loadMaterial() to define an alternative method of loading the material values.
        Parameters:
        name - - the name to be applied to this OBJMaterial
        verbose - - a flag indicating whether the OBJMaterial command processing should be done verbosely. In verbose mode, each individual command is echoed to the console as it is encountered.

    • Method Detail

      • loadMaterial

        public int loadMaterial(java.io.BufferedReader br)
        Loads material data from the specified BufferedReader (file). Returns a count of the number of file lines consumed.
        Specified by:
        loadMaterial in class Material

      • getIllumModel

        public int getIllumModel()
        Returns the integer defining the illumination (shading) type associated with this model.

        Per http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wavefront_.obj_file, OBJ supports the following illumination models (parameter values for the 'illum' command):

        • 0. Color on and Ambient off
        • 1. Color on and Ambient on
        • 2. Highlight on
        • 3. Reflection on and Ray trace on
        • 4. Transparency: Glass on, Reflection: Ray trace on
        • 5. Reflection: Fresnel on and Ray trace on
        • 6. Transparency: Refraction on, Reflection: Fresnel off and Ray trace on
        • 7. Transparency: Refraction on, Reflection: Fresnel on and Ray trace on
        • 8. Reflection on and Ray trace off
        • 9. Transparency: Glass on, Reflection: Ray trace off
        • 10. Casts shadows onto invisible surfaces

        Note that the specification of "illumination model" is strictly an attribute defined in an OBJ file; it is the responsibility of whatever code is rendering the model defined in the file to apply whatever underlying graphics API techniques are required to implement the specified illumination model.

      • getTextureFileName

        public java.lang.String getTextureFileName()
        Returns the String defining the diffuse texture file name which was associated with this OBJMaterial if a texture file name was defined using the OBJ map_Kd command; otherwise null is returned.
        Overrides:
        getTextureFileName in class Material
        Returns:
        the diffuse texture file name for this material

      • loadMaterial

        public boolean loadMaterial()
        Description copied from class: Material
        Loads this material with data from an internally-determined source (for example, prompts for the name of a material definition file and loads from that file). It is up to subclasses to define the mechanism for determining the material definition source.
        Specified by:
        loadMaterial in class Material
        Returns:
        True if the material was successfully loaded; false otherwise.
